Key Match Events: The Phoenix Suns clawed back from a 15-point deficit to edge the Miami Heat 115-112.
Kevin Durant led the Suns with 32 points.
Jusuf Nurkic turned in a commanding performance with 20 points and 18 rebounds.
Durant’s clutch jumper from the free-throw line with just 16 seconds left sealed a four-point cushion for Phoenix.
Tyler Herro stood out for the Heat, scoring 28 points.
Haywood Highsmith provided a strong boost off the bench with 19 points.
Bam Adebayo recorded a double-double with 12 points and 12 rebounds, along with 6 assists and 5 steals.
Miami’s attempt to set up a potential game-tying shot fizzled when Butler passed the ball to Herro, who was positioned out of bounds.
Post-Match Reflections: This latest defeat adds to Miami’s early-season struggles as they continue to search for consistency.
